title: Data connection not required!!
comment: No data connection required for encrypted sms, for data encrypted messages use Threema

title: Thank You Smssecure
comment: Thanks for proving that sms messages can still be secure. Please keep up the great work.

title: Foss, secure and sexy
comment: Irreplaceable. Simple as that.

title: SMS/MMS issues
comment: It is a solid start to a Textsecure replacement, having all the common core privacy features without the need of an internet connection. However, it has a noticeable delay in receiving SMS and has a lackluster (and somewhat broken) MMS capability (constant loading, sending failure, etc.). It is a great service, but these reliability issues are keeping this from being the excellent app that it will someday become. Hopefully they fix this.

title: SMSSecure: Got Moxie
comment: Fast, open source SMS client.   At the star of this year, Moxie Marlinspike's TextSecure project disabled SMS support, after over three years of awesomeness. Why?  To improve privacy, he wrote.   Within a few days, the SecuredText project surfaced. It not only rolled back to the last working version, it completely ripped out cloud messaging.   SecuredText was renamed SMSsecure, and the rest is history.   SMSSecure can run in addition to any other apps you're using, like Google Messaging. Fast, stable, free.

title: PLEASE FIX EMOJIS
comment: Emojis do not work with this app

title: Fast, stable, secure.
comment: It would be nice when sending a sms to a contact with no smssecure to have a link or invitation to download and install the app. When sending from your side a secures sms to another user without smssecure, is it encrypted can the other person read it? Thank you keep up the good work. Keep things simple.

title: Encrypted SMS/MMS is back and it works flawlessly. If you are coming from TextSecure, simply do a plain text export of your TextSecure database before installing SMSSecure. After SMSSecure is installed, it will do an automatic import of the system SMS database
comment: (this step can't be avoided even if you don't use the system default SMS app). After this initial setup, you are set to go... But if you are a TextSecure user, then you will need to import your backed up database (press menu key then select Import/Export, then choose the Import Plaintext Backup). Everything is automated so you don't need to select any files. It's amazingly quick, simple and straightforward to set up.

title: Thank you
comment: Even if the app has bugs, this is what I have always been looking for when it comes to sms encryption. Hopefully an iOS version is on the way so I can get my friends to start using it ☺.  I'll just have to convince my friends to ditch their iPhone then. Don't think that will happen though 😏.
Unfortunately, due to the restrictive nature of the current iOS APIs, SMSSecure can't be ported to iOS.

title: Way faster than TextSecure
comment: This is what TextSecure used to be... Truly didn't need data / WiFi for it to work efficiently. Although some security setbacks due to not directly authenticating with the central server but I can live with speed and efficiency.

Great for sms. Doesn't work for mms, only says  connecting to mms server. Would like option to disable sms preview in notification bar, just show that message has been received. Also would like option for repeat alerts to continue until message is viewed.
We're working on fixing the MMS issues some people with certain carriers are experiencing.
Thx for this fork guys 😊
Awesome!

comment: A great fork of TextSecure with sms encryption.

title: Thank you!
comment: I am so happy to be able to use encrypted text messages again. Thank you so much for your work!
Awesome app

title: Thanks guys
comment: Really appreciate what you are doing!

title: Fake!
comment: This is a fake! Crashes constantly and isn't the real TextSecure!

SMSSecure is a fork of TextSecure that focuses on encrypted communication using SMS/MMS (recently removed from TextSecure).

If you're experiencing crashes, please submit an issue on GitHub and they will be fixed (see the description for a link).

title: Better than Textsecure!
comment: SMSSecure brings back the SMS encryption and removes the privacy problem of needing a central infrastructure where everyone has to register their phone numbers (and why does TextSecure need phone numbers anyway???)
THX for forking textsecure, guys

title: Crashes after boot
comment: ...right after upgrade to New Version. No more access to my SMS??
Apologies for the issue. We've pushed an update that fixes the issue (currently available). You'll be able to access your messages after v0.5.3.
A+

title: Does what it says
comment: This app finally does again what TextSecure wanted to do when they started: Send encrypted SMS/Text messages. Since TextSecure dropped the support for their main use case, SMSSecure brings this back. Thanks!
